Key Match Events: Josh Smith put Texas ahead for the first time with a two-run single in the seventh inning.
Marcus Semien’s RBI single followed a five-for-39 stretch for the Texas leadoff hitter.
Jose Leclerc retired the only two batters he faced in the seventh inning.
Kirby Yates worked the ninth for his 28th save in 29 chances.
Taylor Ward led off the game with his 22nd homer, extending his on-base streak to 17 games.
Jack Leiter had a career-best six strikeouts in his sixth start.
Ezequiel Duran lined a two-run double deep into the left-center gap in the fifth inning.
Neto scored from second base on a wild pitch in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Bruce Bochy commented on the Rangers' 32nd comeback win of the season.
Angels manager Ron Washington reflected on Tyler Anderson's performance and the team's inability to hold onto the lead.
Miscellaneous Highlights: With the Globe Life Park roof open for the first time since May 17, Taylor Ward led off the game with his 22nd homer.
Angels outfielders Jo Adell and Kevin Pillar were placed on the 10-day injured list.
Jacob deGrom struck out five without a walk while yielding only one hit over four innings for double-A Frisco in his fourth and likely final rehab start.
Max Scherzer was making a rehab start for triple-A Round Rock in Las Vegas.
